Comment: And the stock price goes up...   Why?.. Because DOGE was never about saving money. It's all about smashing "the regulatory" state that is slowing down Tesla's long-term ambitions (which is primarily industrial B2B, not necessarily selling cars to consumers). The consumer brand gets a beating, the corporate industrial brand gets the win. The stock price goes up.   I despise the man as much as anyone. But celebrating dropping sales is missing the point. Musk and the PayPal Mafia, for the most part, got what they paid for, which was taking a chainsaw to the institutions that get in their way.

Comment: There was no option to release an affordable Tesla in the US. So much of the cost is the battery, so to sell an affordable Tesla they'd have to experience a breakthrough in battery costs or make the battery much smaller, and there just isn't a market in the US for a 150 mile EV.   Teslas are already stripped-down, lacking basic features like instrument panels and radar. You can only save so much by trimming physical features from a car that already lacks them, and sells itself on software.  Now I don't fault you for saying this because Elon himself has talked a lot about releasing an affordable EV. It's just always been hot air.
